public class OrderPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ContainerListener, javax.swing.event.CaretListener

Panel that is displayed in left part of the screen, contains all information concerning current order.

Author:
Kamil Mrowiec

Constructor Detail

OrderPanel

public OrderPanel(Till till)
Method Detail

resetOrder

public void resetOrder()
Cleans panel after saving order.

payForOrder

public void payForOrder()
Adds current order to list of orders, shows info that order is saved, then cleans all panels so that new order can be taken.

updateTotalPrice

public void updateTotalPrice()
Gets subtotal from order, calculates if any discounts are applicable, and updates adequate text labels.

removeEmptyItems

public void removeEmptyItems()
Removes from currentOrder every OrderItem with Quantity equal to zero.

addItemToOrder

public void addItemToOrder(Item item)
Called when any StoreItemButton is cliked, what triggers adding item to order. It checks if such item has already been added to the order, if so, only quantity increases, otherwise new order position is created.

Parameters:
item - Item to be added

getMiddlePanel

public OrderItemsListPanel getMiddlePanel()
Returns:
Panel with OrderItems.

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent arg0)
This listener method checks if "PAY" button has been clicked. If so, payForOrder() method is called. It also maintains cancellation of order.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
See Also:
ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

isReadyToPay

public void isReadyToPay()
Method checks for changes in custNameField and middlePanel, i. e. if customer name has been filled and if the order is not empty. The "PAY" button depends of those two things - it turns green when both requisites are fulfilled.
